segments.advisor_message: So, like, think of risk as, um, crossing a street, right? If you just, you know, run across without lookin', you’re taking a big risk. But if you, like, wait for the green light and look both ways, that's like managing your risk better.
segments.client_message: I, um, kinda get that, but like, isn’t risk just, you know, something we just avoid? Why would I want to, uh, think about crossing at all?

segments.advisor_message: Good question! Avoiding risk is, uh, like never crossing the street at all. But then you might, you know, miss out on opportunities. Like, if you don’t cross, you won’t get to the other side, which can, uh, hold you back!
segments.client_message: Oh, so, um, if I think of it like that, it’s like, I have to decide when to, like, take the plunge with my pension, right? It’s, um, confusing though, what’s a safe amount to risk?
